jobs.title: Senior Web Developer - Full Stack
jobs.description:
Like millions of other people you probably know TimePlay from being at the movies. TimePlay Inc. the company behind the well-loved game and app has a proven track record of connecting casual gamers through immersive social play.

TimePlay is currently combining proprietary and 3rd party content with a powerful platform and distribution model that creates rich social experiences from a single living room to connecting players across the world. TimePlay is currently working on taking its leading edge technology to new partners so they can also provide these same experiences to consumers.

As TimePlay continues to evolve they are looking for a Sr. Web Developer - Full Stack to lead the design, build and scaling of their current platform and the multiple components that go into making the virtual experience seamless for users.

What you will do:
• Help create content management tools; this is currently the highest priority in this role; in addition to helping contribute to maintaining and... improving our existing microservices, you will develop content management tools and new microservices that we wish to create.
• Design, build and scale our current platform; as part of this, you will be writing, maintaining and delivering expert code. You will oversee development of the web client that supports timeplay.tv, and be the primary owner of the front-end streaming platform and the integration with the back-end. You will work in and with some of the following technologies in both back-end and front-end developer capacities. You will need to enhance the existing components in order to achieve maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers. Lastly, you will need to add customization to the existing web applications on an ongoing basis.
• Manage, solve and improve complexities in the technology stack; at TimePlay we don’t always do everything in a standard way, therefore we will rely on you to de-construct complex business requirements and rely on your ability to think outside the box to help TimePlay achieve its goals. On a regular basis you will be required to provide technical guidance and support in resolving critical issues that center around the streaming platform, the game controllers, and other components of our technology.
• Act as a leader on the team and mentor junior team members; collaboration with team members is our top priority. You will be working with people both senior and junior to you, whom you will be expected to mentor and guide through the many challenges they may face, like the learning curve of a new technology or a challenging technical task.

Who you are:
• A leader; that can mean many things but at TimePlay that means you work with others to positively solve-problems, you look for possibilities instead of putting up roadblocks, you drop any ego around your work and are willing to be the first person to make a sacrifice for the team.
• Curious learner who is always executing; as a senior developer we expect that you’re always curious about how things work and willing to dig into learning something new at all times. This curiosity and learning translates into you being proactive about working on priorities and being ambitious about what we can achieve together. You don’t need someone to tell you what to do next, and are happy to take the lead.
• A humble collaborator; Our biggest team priority is collaboration and seeking different opinions and perspectives. You are someone who’s ego doesn’t get in the way of sharing work, being open to making change and admitting when you don’t know.
• Calculated risk taker; you use as much input and data as possible before you make a decision, but you also know when to take a risk in order to move something forward. You focus on how things can be improved and are constantly learning from failure. Not only do you do this for your role, but you work to create a culture of learning from failure for the junior team.

Requirements:
• Experience working with Node.js
• Experience working with relational and document databases
• Experience in building fault-tolerant, distributed systems
• Experience with AWS is an asset
• Experience working with Python is an asset
• Experience working with one of React, Mithril.js is an asset
• Unix/Linux background is an asset

Why Work With Us:

We offer so much more than a competitive salary ($90k-100k for this role), a health and dental plan with a generous health spending account, and an employee stock option plan, though we know those are important too. At its core, TimePlay is a high-tech, cutting edge platform and we believe that nothing is impossible. We don’t settle for mediocrity. We view challenges as opportunities and constantly push the boundaries because that’s how greatness is achieved. We’ve been around for a while, but we’re a small and nimble team that believes in innovation and progress. Because of our size and the value we place on collaboration, you will have the opportunity to work with senior leaders, share your ideas, and influence the direction of our business. If you’re a passionate learner who is motivated by the potential to shape your own work and the future of your career, we want to hear from you!

To Apply:

We are a respectful workplace committed to building a skilled and diverse workforce. We believe in fostering an inclusive work environment where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. We welcome and encourage applications from everyone. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process.

We look forward to hearing from you!

TimePlay focuses on Games, Social Games, and Mobile Games. Their company has offices in Toronto. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

You can view their website at https://www.timeplay.com

In addition, The MRG Group owns and operates an events business, travel company, digital publication, and ticketing service Admit One. In 2021, the business expanded its presence into the US, signing its first venue deals with properties in New York and California later that year.

Reporting directly to one of the Principal Software Engineers, the Junior Developer would be spending most of their time implementing solutions to our mobile, frontend and, potentially, backend infrastructures in response to Product-driven user stories and other... technical tasks assigned to them.

Think you have what it takes? Willing to roll up your sleeves and get things done? Let’s talk!

jobs.title: Associate Back End Developer
jobs.description:
Bonsai’s mission is to help people find and buy the products they want, as soon as they realize they want them. We began in 2016 as a streetwear style and news app. Now we’re leading the market shift to content-driven commerce. We are helping publishers launch e-commerce as a new line of business. We already do this for over 200M+ monthly unique visitors on some of North America’s leading publishers, including BuzzFeed and Complex. We’ve been featured in the Wall Street Journal and Business Insider for leading the charge in a new wave of native commerce, but the opportunity is still largely untapped.

Our technology allows users to transact natively while browsing content. We make the journey from seeing a product to buying it possible in two taps. Our vision is to make this possible everywhere you discover products. For publishers, we provide a powerful revenue alternative to ads that also improves the user experience. For merchants, Bonsai allows them to capture customers while they... browse content, right when purchasing intent is being formed.

At Bonsai, we pride ourselves on the transparent and performance-driven environment we’ve created for our team. We value making data driven-decisions and taking calculated risks that add value to our users.

We are looking for a Backend Developer to become an integral and influential part of our Integrations team and our broader development community. You will be working on iterating and developing new features, improving existing ones and fixing bugs.

What will I be doing?
• Write clear, well-documented and structured code that follows best practices.
• Participate in code reviews with other teammates.
• Work with other teams to gather and refine specifications and requirements based on technical needs.
• Independently analyze problems and develop creative solutions.
• Troubleshooting real-world production issues under fire.
• Hold team members' code to a high standard during reviews to maintain a quality codebase.
• Work and communicate effectively within a cross-functional team.
• Troubleshoot, test and maintain code to ensure it is optimized, performs well and is high quality.

What do I need?
• Comfortable working with NodeJS
• Eager to learn and passionate about development.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
• Curious and a creative problem solver.
• A self-starter mindset. You love being in the weeds and are known for rolling up your sleeves to get things done. You never let roadblocks get in the way of getting things done; the laws of physics govern the only limits to what you can do.
• Time management and prioritization skills. Things change. The role requires someone who is used to juggling several tasks simultaneously and operating under uncertainty. You will need to work both hard and smart; one alone will not suffice.

Massive bonus if you have some experience in any of the following stacks:
• MongoDB
• Quality Assurance tools
• Relational databases (Postgres, SQL, mySQL)
• Typescript
• Cloud platform expertise
• Docker
• Some test framework (jest, mocha)

What to expect:
• Review - you’ll hear from us regardless
• Intro Call - a quick call with the Head of People to discuss the role and learn who you are!
• An interview with some of the team - 45 minutes to go over your background, the role and Bonsai. Also, an excellent time for you to ask any questions you have.
• Take-Home Assessment - a realistic problem to solve.
• Virtual Interview - a 2-hour interview to meet the team, and your chance to interview us.
• Offer - Ideally, this is the part where we make the offer, you accept, and we all celebrate!

At Bonsai, we are committed to building and fostering a diverse and inclusive environment where our employees feel valued, heard, and supported. We believe that a commitment to diversity, inclusion and belonging enables us to do the best work of our lives - building the future of content and commerce! We strongly encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds, experience, and perspectives regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, age, citizenship, disability, and national origin.

Bonsai welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the hiring and selection process. If you require accommodations or have any questions, please email us at accessibility@shopbonsai.ca.

Bonsai focuses on Mobile, E-Commerce, Fashion, and Retail Technology. Their company has offices in Toronto. They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees.

You can view their website at https://shopbonsai.ca or find them on LinkedIn

jobs.title: Technical Analyst/Web Developer
jobs.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story.

At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers.

This is an exciting opportunity between web development, UX design and project management skills. This position will report to the Manager, Business Applications and Services and will be part of a lean team that supports Oxford's business applications landscape. Oxford Properties owns over 200 domains. We are... looking for someone to assist with managing and maintaining all of Oxford's websites. This includes the intake of new websites and maintenance of all the existing ones. We are looking for someone with technical skills to understand the configuration and the code and be comfortable making most of the changes and updates hands-on. The individual would also assist with the design process from a technical standpoint as a consultant for the feasibility of technical implementation based on current limitations. The ideal candidate would also own the website's technical process from end to end, from creating a project plan; to design, implement, document and maintain steady state. The simplest way is to treat websites as a product and build a service model for providing websites as a service.

Knowledge and Skills:

Proven working experience or training in web programming or web development.

programming skills and knowledge of modern HTML/CSS

Familiarity with PHP, ASP.NET, and JavaScript (nice to have)

basic understanding of web applications, including security, session management, and best practices

basic knowledge and understanding of SQL.

Hands-on experience with network diagnostics, network analytics tools

Basic knowledge of the Search Engine Optimization process

Aggressive problem diagnosis and creative problem-solving skills.

Strong organizational skills and excellent time management

Strong communication and presentation skills, including comfort with influencing others to reach a consensus, active listening, and empathy.

Strong problem-solving skills are required to investigate and research issues, interpret information, and modify existing procedures.

Experience with customer journey mapping, wireframing, product design and prototyping tools such as Figma, Illustrator.

Solid understanding of responsive design practices and knowledge around testing on multiple devices.

Understanding of WCAG and accessible design standards.

Experience with using SharePoint, Confluence Wiki, JIRA or similar tools.

Experience and understanding of User Experience Design processes and tools.

Experience and understanding of Agile Processes in product development.

Good knowledge of User Personas, User Scenarios, User Flows, Information Architecture and Customer Experience maps.

Responsibilities

Perform work within general policies and guidelines, with the ability to work autonomously to determine what tasks should be completed according to agreed-upon goals.

Exercise latitude in determining objectives to support department, organization and project goals.

Responsible for decisions and advice that impact the immediate technical team, tactical solutions and ideas may be required to assist with removing roadblocks.

Provide service by probing current and future needs, which requires a full understanding of possible service options to design a solution that looks beyond immediate needs and builds an ongoing relationship.

Lead and provide subject matter expertise to projects and initiatives.

Identify risks, issues and impacts.

Identify improvement opportunities and escalate issues/risks to the supervisor!

Propose and execute solutions.

Identify and manage risks and issues related to operational deliverables and project completion, identify resolution options and recommended course of action.

Develop creative and innovative approaches for addressing business, project, and operational service needs.

Perform duties as lead project manager for all web projects.

User Research & Customer Knowledge

Lead the technical planning, design, and facilitation of websites about different asset classes i.e., residential, retail, industrial, etc.), working with product owners and business users. Must be comfortable conducting research both remotely and in person.

Ability to establish UX Research (testing) criteria and UX Research goals, assess outcomes, and translate results into actionable UX/UI improvements within the product (nice to have).

Recommend both qualitative and quantitative UX Research methodologies and tools. Produce supporting artifacts to support UX Research engagements including sketches, storyboards, and prototypes, when required (nice to have).

Technical Product Design

Translate user research, business requirements, and user requirements into streamlined Customer Journey Maps and User Flows on which to build user experience design solutions for the websites as a product.

Rationalize solutions and effectively communicate ideas and designs via Sitemaps, User Flows, Wireframes, Prototypes and high-fidelity mock-ups. Consult and guide technical developers, content writers, and QA to align with the desired user experience and specifications.

Create wireframes, mock-ups and prototypes following the UX design framework and product brand guidelines & specifications.

Ensure every piece of information and data surfaced on UI is useful and relevant to users’ needs.

Create, maintain and validate UX artifacts such as Customer Journey Maps, User Personas, User Scenarios, Information Architecture, User Flows and Prototypes.

Project Management/Delivery

Develop an understanding of the OMERS/Oxford digital strategy & implement standards as well as supporting processes to adhere to the standard across any assigned projects or digital products.

In collaboration with vendors and the BMC team, follow established UX design patterns, product brand guidelines & specifications and product UX design framework. Design, refine, and aim to establish consistent, coherent and accessible experiences across all digital products and services.

Demonstrate a good understanding and practices of UX design principles, UX research methodologies, UI design and usability guidelines through hands-on experience.

Create well-articulated project plans and lead the delivery of all existing and future projects initiated to assist the brand marketing and communications team and meet the business needs.

Education/Experience

Completion of college diploma required; university degree preferred.

1 year of related work experience in a technical CX or UX role, with a strong preference for candidates with a Project management background

Strong preference for bilingual candidates (English and French).

Strong preference for certification or courses in CX/UX/UI-related courses.

Previous B2B and B2C experience is an asset.

Experience working with and setting up GA4 configurations and Google Tag manager.

Our story:

Oxford Properties Group (“Oxford”) is a leading global real estate investor, asset manager and business builder. It builds, buys, and grows defined real estate operating business with world-class management teams. Established in 1960, Oxford and its portfolio companies manage approximately C$87 billion of assets across four continents on behalf of their investment partners. Oxford’s owned portfolio encompasses office, logistics, retail, multifamily residential, life sciences, hotels, alternatives and credit in global gateway cities and high-growth hubs. A thematic investor with a committed source of capital, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities, and real estate businesses across the risk-reward spectrum. Together with its portfolio companies, Oxford is one of the world’s most active developers with over 80 projects currently underway globally across all major asset classes. Oxford is owned by OMERS, the Canadian defined benefit pension plan for Ontario's municipal employees.

For more information on Oxford, visit www.oxfordproperties.com

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives

jobs.title: Front-end Developer
jobs.description:
About iFocus Beauty

iFocus is an innovative web and app-based startup founded in 2019. We act as your digital beauty assistant, helping clinics thrive and grow by leveraging data analytics and e-commerce to deliver the best-quality products and services to customers.

Our mission is to redefine the way people interact with the medical aesthetics industry, making it more accessible and easier to navigate than ever before. From finding clinics, to booking appointments, to identifying the best products and treatments for specific skin types, we have our customers covered with all things beauty.

We recognize that our people are our greatest strength and the diverse talents they bring to our workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company.

About the Tech Team

Our technology team relies on smart, driven people like you to develop applications and provide tech support for all functions... across our network. Your efforts will touch lives all over the aesthetic medicine spectrum. You’ll be part of a team specifically built to meet and exceed our evolving technology needs, as well as our technology controls agenda.

What is the Opportunity?

As an experienced professional in our organization:
• You will perform the full life cycle web application development, including researching available technical options for features, providing guidance and feedback on the findings and building proof of concepts to confirm the best approach.
• You will build user-friendly web / mobile web pages or mobile app experiences, adhering to industry standards for best practice.
• You will aid Product Management in the creation of product road maps and ensuring objectives are realistic and achievable.
• You will be involved in deployment, automation, management, and maintenance of cloud-based production systems, and ensure availability, performance, security, and scalability of cloud systems.
• You are expected to stay current with latest development tools, technology ideas, patterns and methodologies, and share knowledge by clearly articulating results and ideas to the team.
• You’ll work with a highly motivated team focused on analyzing, designing, developing, and delivering solutions to strengthen our operations.
• You’ll help us deliver cost-effective solutions that put our clients first.
• You’ll deploy best practices, new policies and emerging trends to strengthen our strategic roadmap.
• You’ll sharpen your communication and presentation skills by presenting your findings to senior leaders.
• Your work will have a critical impact on our company, as well as our clients and our business partners.

This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:

Must have:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or in “STEM” Majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math)
• 2+ years experience building in client-side Javascript frameworks: React
• 2+ years of experience in networking, security and infrastructure architecture
• Experience with Mobile Application Development, git, and Modern CSS frameworks (Tailwind, bootstrap)
• Conversant knowledge of full-cycle software engineering best practices, including code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operational support

Nice to have:
• Professional or personal experience with SQL (PostgreSQL or MySQL), NoSQL, and in-memory database
• Working knowledge with JavaScript technology stack (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, NodeJS)
• Expert working knowledge of at least one of the programming languages: C/C++, Python, Java, or Go

Are you ready to pursue new challenges and develop your career with iFocus? To apply:

• Please share any previous work (personal portfolio/production website) if possible

At iFocus, we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

iFocus Beauty focuses on Crowdsourcing, Beauty, Health and Wellness, Web Development, and Ecommerce. Their company has offices in Toronto. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

Job Title: Front-end Web Developer

A Web Developer will contribute to the design, coding, and maintenance of the company’s internal- and external-facing web applications. Together with team members, a Web Developer will have the opportunity to work with modern techniques and frameworks in order to build engaging user experiences for customers and company employees. jobs.title: Senior Web Developer- Backend
jobs.description:
Like millions of other people you probably know TimePlay from being at the movies. TimePlay Inc. the company behind the well-loved game and app has a proven track record of connecting casual gamers through immersive social play.

TimePlay is currently combining proprietary and 3rd party content with a powerful platform and distribution model that creates rich social experiences from a single living room to connecting players across the world. TimePlay is currently working on taking its leading edge technology to new partners so they can also provide these same experiences to consumers.

As TimePlay continues to evolve they are looking for a Sr. Web Developer - Back-end to focus on maintaining and scaling the backend streaming platform.

What you will do:
• Take ownership of our streaming platform; you will become the expert in our back-end streaming platform by focusing on improving and increasing its capacity. Currently, our streaming platform uses a combination of open source... products (Janus) and other technology that is written in C. You will also work in Node.js and Go to build back-end services and APIs that support others in the development of our customer-facing product. You will work on dealing with RTP connections, UDP traffic, client firewall issues and debugging latency issues.
• Create and execute on a plan to scale the streaming platform; The goal is to have millions of users on the streaming platform with the low latency we currently support. You will work with the technology team to identify and create the plan required to make this happen. You will then be responsible for delivering on the plan.
• Support and debug the streaming platform; you will be the main point of contact for debugging requests or support requests from users. More importantly, you will focus on creating long term fixes when problems arise.
• Maintain microservice architecture; our technology stack can be complicated and involves a lot of microservices, you will have a lot of experience architecting, developing and maintaining these as they relate to the entire product.

Who you are:
• Someone who likes to work autonomously; while the upfront work assignment, planning and trouble-shooting is very collaborative, you are someone who is happy to take input and then go work on your own to achieve your targets.
• Passionate learner; you have a thirst for learning and are constantly seeking to develop and hone your skills. You have a focus on back-end API’s, microservices and functional programming and are willing to continue to develop your skills in these areas.
• A humble collaborator; our biggest team priority is collaboration and seeking different opinions and perspectives. You are someone who’s ego doesn’t get in the way of sharing work, being open to making change and admitting when you don’t know.
• Executer, focused on quality; the quality of our back-end technology is critical to ensure our front-end experience is something that we are incredibly proud of. You take psychological ownership over your domain, thinking ahead of problems and proactively solving them. You focus on quality work knowing that what you do on the back-end will influence everyone else’s work in the engineering department.

Requirements:
• Deep experience building backend services and APIs, ideally using NodeJs, Go, Elixir
• Experience building microservices
• Experience working with relational and document databases
• Experience in building fault-tolerant, distributed systems
• Unix/Linux background
• Understanding of the OSI model, TCP/IP, UDP and preferably RTP an asset
• Experience working with one of React, Mithril.js an asset

Why Work With Us:

We offer so much more than a competitive salary ($90-100K for this role), a health and dental plan with a generous health spending account, and an employee stock option plan, though we know those are important too! At its core, TimePlay is a high-tech, cutting edge platform and we believe that nothing is impossible. We don’t settle for mediocrity. We view challenges as opportunities and constantly push the boundaries because that’s how greatness is achieved. We’ve been around for a while, but we’re a small and nimble team that believes in innovation and progress. Because of our size and the value we place on collaboration, you will have the opportunity to work with senior leaders, share your ideas, and influence the direction of our business. If you’re a passionate learner who is motivated by the potential to shape your own work and the future of your career, we want to hear from you!

To Apply:

We are a respectful workplace committed to building a skilled and diverse workforce. We believe in fostering an inclusive work environment where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. We welcome and encourage applications from everyone. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process.

We look forward to hearing from you!

TimePlay focuses on Games, Social Games, and Mobile Games. Their company has offices in Toronto. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

You can view their website at https://www.timeplay.com

jobs.title: Volunteer: Website Designer
jobs.description:
DiverseMinds is a platform for every talented individual in this world. We believe that there is no single person who are the same. Everyone is unique and talented in their way. Neurodiversity is the concept that there are many different variations in human function, each of which needs to be better understood and respected. Society needs to realize how intelligent and talented our peers are. DiverseMinds research field is mainly focused on female neurodiversity. There is no single research about women in neurodiversity. DiverseMinds wanted to create this platform for women in neurodiversity to use their words to influence others, and this is what brings everyone joy-to connect people and connect with people. We believe that women in neurodiversity deserve the opportunity to express themselves. We believe that through conversation, we inspire each other, learn from each other, and create opportunities for each other. Most importantly, we believe that it is through conversation that we... can share our thoughts and emotion to support each other in a patriarchal society.

About Us

DiverseMinds is a non-profit organization launched in May 2022 by youth leaders and neurodiversity specialists. We are dedicated to serving more than 2k neurodivergent women and readers. With our resource integration platform, DiverseMinds empower audiences with tips, insights and challenging common misconceptions from the latest health, wellness and beauty research and spark discussion about neurodivergence in women - presented in a fun, engaging way that helps audiences lead confident, healthy lives.

As a web designer at DiverseMinds Magazine, you’ll build websites for exciting companies and you’ll execute every stage of the process with tons of creative control. Please note that coding knowledge is NOT required for this position.

We’re looking for a highly motivated team member with strong communication skills, a keen eye for design, and a self-starter mentality.

Responsibilities
• Design and develop stunning websites on Wix
• Implement basic SEO tasks (no prior SEO experience is required)

Requirements
• Provide a portfolio of previous web design work. The platform on which you built your previous websites doesn’t matter (we just need to know that you’re a good designer). Your portfolio can be delivered in any format (active website URLs, screenshots, design files, etc, but active website URLs are preferred) and you can also include other types of designs in your portfolio (graphic design, logo design, etc)

Please submit your resume and profolio to info@diversemindsco.com

This is a volunteer opportunity provided by VolunteerMatch, in partnership with LinkedIn for Good

jobs.title: Front-End Developer

The Front-End Developer will report to Shany Mo, VP of Product at 6ix.

Job Overview: 6ix is looking for a talented and ambitious Front-End Developer to join the product team. The successful candidate will be responsible for the impeccable implementation of 6ix’s products. You will be ensuring that the user interface design is implemented, the user experience is world-class, and all aspects are on brand.

Your work will be critical to 6ix’s success in offering a powerful, seamless experience to our clients now, and as we continue to scale.

Responsibilities and Duties:

Developing the front-end of the various tools 6ix employs

Running comprehensive usability tests to ensure it meets the highest standards possible.

Ensuring our product runs seamlessly on all devices and browsers.

Develop and implement strategies on how to enhance the user experience across our products.

Collaborate with back-end developers to integrate with their solutions.

Build reusable code and libraries for... future use and follow emerging technologies.

Track your key performance indicators (KPIs) and be accountable to achieving them.

Communicate and coordinate closely with team members and manager to ensure that deliverables are of high-quality and on-time.

Qualifications:

5 years experience in a similar role.

Fluent in HTML, CSS (critical)

Fluent in Bootstrap, Angular JS, ReactJS, Ember.

Must have experience with the latest Angular Framework 2/4/6/7/8/9.

Experience working with server-side CSS pre-processing platforms like LESS, SASS.

Experience working with client-side scripting and Javascript frameworks.

Familiarity with design tools (Figma, Sketch, Photoshop)

Solid understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and work arounds

Experienced in cloud-based solutions and responsive design.

Experience working in an Agile environment.

A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related degree.

Excellent communication skills and an ability to work as part of a time in a fast-moving environment.

Excellent organizational skills and an ability to set and meet ambitious targets.

Why 6ix?

This role is for mission-driven people that want to leave the world in a better state than how they found it.

We’re pursuing this mission because for too long, economic opportunities have been limited to those with connections or those with existing wealth. Our products and services democratize access to investment opportunities so that people can live better lives and participate in how the world around them gets built.

Our mission spans 7 continents (including Antarctica), 10 billion people (we give consideration to past and future generations) and is fundamentally a mission about leaving the world in a better state than how we found it.

Will you join us?

6ix focuses on SaaS, Social Media Marketing, Email Marketing, Internet Marketing, and Content Marketing. Their company has offices in Toronto. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

You can view their website at http://6ix.com or find them on Twitter and LinkedIn

Equinix is the world's digital infrastructure company, operating 210 data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.

At Equinix, we help the world's digital leaders scale with agility, speed the launch of digital services, deliver world-class experiences, and transform people's lives. Our culture is based on collaboration and the growth and development of our teams.

We hire hardworking people who thrive on solving challenging problems and give them opportunities to hone new skills, and try new approaches, as we grow our product portfolio with new software and network architecture solutions. We embrace diversity in thought and... contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.

Job Summary: Frontend Developer responsibilities include gathering user requirements, designing graphic elements, and building web components. To be successful in this role, you should have experience with design software and wireframe tools, along with a strong development skillset with several programming languages including JavaScript, React and SASS. This should all be combined with a solid understanding of how to deliver a satisfying user experience. You will work alongside product teams, analysts, and other engineers to design systems and application software, as well as drive design decisions based on customer needs and requirements.

Responsibilities

Requirements Analysis

Development/Coding

• Provide status reports and release management progress updates

R&D/Innovation
• Investigate, analyze, and evaluate new technologies
• Understand the limitations of our tech stack and business model and provide technical advice wherever necessary.

Qualifications
• 5+ years' experience as a front-end developer with a focus on user experience
• Bachelor's Degree in computer science, software engineering, or equivalent experience
• A portfolio that demonstrates both JavaScript proficiency and understanding of design principles is not required, but desirable

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.description:
The Rotman Research Institute at Baycrest has an opportunity for

WEB DEVELOPER

Non-Union, 70 hours Bi-weekly

One year, renewable

The Rotman Research Institute (RRI) is a premier interdisciplinary, international centre for the study of human brain function. Our core research themes are: Cognitive Neuroscience, Aging and Brain Health, Alzheimer’s and Related Diseases, Computational Modeling and Neuroinformatics. Our research focuses on cognitive brain functions (including memory, executive function, attention, perception, and language), both in normal aging and in the presence of diseases and conditions that affect the brain, such as Alzheimer’s disease and other dementias, stroke, and traumatic brain injury. The Rotman Research Institute supports behavioral, neuropsychological, neuroimaging, and neurocomputational studies with state-of-the-art facilities, including eye-tracking, electroencephalography, and magnetoencephalography laboratories and a research-dedicated Siemens 3 Tesla... MRI in-house at Baycrest.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
• Creating, designing, development and maintaining software for a medical health screening application with a focus on client-side application development
• Working with a team of researchers and healthcare workers aiming to move “pen and paper” clinical screening tests to a user-friendly tablet or web browser-based device.
• Work with other technical, clinical, and research staff to develop solution
• Attend weekly team meetings to report on progress
• Consult with project manager and stakeholders to develop and document requirements
• Research and evaluate software options
• Create mock-ups and modify iteratively as needed

Qualifications include but are not limited to:
• Post-Secondary Degree in Computer Science or equivalent in combination of skills and experience in a related field
• Minimum 2 years’ experience working as a client-side web-application developer
• Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing
• Experience with Git or a similar version control system
• Experience with web development (JavaScript, jQuery, CSS, AJAX)
• Experience in cross-platform web/mobile application development (graphical user interfaces, Javascript, HTML/CSS)
• Familiarity with databases and client-server communication
• Familiarity with automated testing and testing frameworks
• Willingness to learn in general, and to learn new technologies in particular
• Ability to work both independently and as part of a team

JOIN OUR TEAM: Please submit your application online by clicking the Apply button below. Applications will include a recent CV, a brief letter of interest, and names and contact information of 3 potential references. Although the closing date for applications is November 15, 2022 we encourage individuals to submit their applications as early as possible.

The Rotman Research Institute is committed to fostering a climate of equity, diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. This commitment is central to, and mutually supportive of, our research excellence mandate. We welcome and respect the diversity of all members of our community, and we support an inclusive culture for our clients, families, research scientists, staff, and participants, trainees, volunteers, trustees, and partners. We welcome applications from Black individuals and other racialized persons, Indigenous Peoples, women, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ2SA+ persons, and others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas within our community. We are committed to fair assessment of a candidate’s abilities, and consideration for diversity of thought, method, and experience, including non- traditional career paths. Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process where needed.

Please note that Baycrest has implemented mandatory vaccination for all employees. It is a condition of employment that new employees provide proof that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to the start date of employment. This means that all new employees must have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada at least 14 days prior to their start date. In addition, it is a condition of employment that all new hires obtain and submit proof of all booster vaccines as approved and recommended by Health Canada.

Applicants who have appropriate written proof of a medical reason, or a reason pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code, for not being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may provide such documentation to the Human Resources department. Such situations will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

Remarkable people of Baycrest Health Sciences

are changing the future of brain health and aging.

Thank you for your interest in joining Baycrest. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Baycrest is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (‘AODA’). If you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources at recruitment@baycrest.org or 416-785-2500, ext. 2961.

All successful candidates will be required to complete a police reference check/vulnerable sector screen and submit proof of two doses of vaccination against COVID-19, unless exempt. Such exemptions will be considered on a case-by-case basis

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.description:
About Paytm Labs:

At Paytm Labs, we’re on a mission to provide useful technological solutions that enrich and empower millions of people in their daily lives. We apply big data, artificial intelligence, and machine learning to bring the next generation of financial products and services to global markets.

We recently soft-launched Pi, our full end-to-end fraud management system that is able to make real-time decisions. It works as a dynamic rule engine to make day-to-day analyses and procedures. Check out more about Pi here: pi.paytm.com.

Job Description:

As a front end Developer, you will be producing scalable software solutions. You will be responsible for the development and improvement of our real-time fraud solution’s admin system. You should be comfortable with ES6, TypeScript, React, GraphQL, and third-party libraries. You must be able to pick up new skills quickly. We are looking for a team player with a knack for visual design and utility.

Responsibilities:
• Build... test, and maintain the front end for our admin system
• Write effective unit and integration tests
• Write technical documentation
• Build the front-end of applications through visually appealing design
• Compose the graphql schema in an effective manner in a way that leverages caching and prevents unnecessary API requests to the backend
• Test system to ensure responsiveness and efficiency
• Work closely with business and product teams to enhance UX Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade system whenever applicable

Qualifications:
• Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
• 2+ years of current, demonstrable experience with React
• Experience with React functional components, hooks, react-router
• Experience with authentication, including token storage and handling
• Calling API’s
• Great attention to detail
• GraphQL

Why join Pi!
• For the fifth year in a row, we are proud to announce that we have been certified as a Great Place to Work
• We are an open work environment that fosters collaboration, ownership, creativity, and urgency
• We ensure flexible hours outside of our core working hours
• Enrolment in the Group Health Benefits plan right from day 1, no waiting period
• Team building events
• Support skill development and continue learning
• Fuel for the day: Weekly delivery of groceries, and all types of snacks
• Daily fun in the office with our competitive games of Ping Pong, Pool, multiple board games, and video games

We thank all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

“We pooled our knowledge of the space and our world-class engineering talent to produce Pi. It’s everything we wanted in an FRM, saving us hundreds of millions of dollars.” - Harinder Takhar, CEO

Go Big or Go Home!

Paytm Labs believes in diversity and equal opportunity and we will not tolerate any forms of discrimination or harassment. Our people are critical to our success and we know the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

We thank all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Paytm Labs is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of all individuals in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) and the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC). Should you require accommodations during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know

jobs.title: Coordinator, Jr. Web Developer and Support
jobs.description:
Coordinator, Jr. Web Developer and Support
• Central location, close to transit (TTC), bike lanes
• Flexible location of work (hybrid)
• Meaningful non-profit organization work

Are you an aspiring web developer with a knack for communications? If you're looking to take the next step in your career to work on exciting web projects with purpose, we want you on our team!

We’re the Ontario Dental Association, and we represent over 90% of dentists in Ontario: advocating on their behalf to improve dentistry for both dentists and patients and keeping Ontarians smiling.

We’re looking for a highly creative and communicative induvial to join our team as Coordinator, Jr. Web Developer and Support.

The Position

This role requires technical savvy along with the ability to manage and facilitate communication to collaborate with vendors and non-technical stakeholders. You’ll work closely with the Senior Director of Governance and Component Society Relations as well as members inside the... department and across the organization to help us advocate for the profession, promote good oral health, and provide support for our members.

This position is ideal for someone with a passion for web development, excellent organizational skills, and a desire to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment. Strong interpersonal skills will be invaluable as you assist the team with outward facing communications and assignments.

Practically speaking, you will:
• Develop and maintain The Bridge, an extranet site through:
• Collaboration with website vendor to re-design and develop the site (2023-2025).
• Update and manage website content, ensuring it aligns with association’s goals, events, and experience.
• Ensure the website is responsive and accessible across various devices and browsers.
• Work with vendor to implement security best practices and ensure site integrity (e.g. user permissions)
• Identifying and resolving technical issues and bugs promptly to maintain site functionality.
• Email broadcast development in collaboration with component society volunteers.
• Assist with different technologies used in supporting component societies (e.g. Formstack, event registration).
• Assist with editing video content for extranet site and other ODA uses.
• Assist component societies with other logistics associated with events (e.g. continuing education certificates, Association Management System reports)
• Assist with the annual Component Society Leadership Summit including on site.
• Assist in the development of The Component Society Leader – a newsletter for component society volunteers.
• Work closely with teams inside the department and across the organization
• Other duties as assigned.
• Occasional overtime required.

Working at the ODA

This is a full-time, permanent position, with hybrid flexibility. In addition to a competitive salary, you’ll have access to a benefits plan that includes dental (of course!) as well as plenty of vacation days, personal days, and access to a health-spending account.

The ODA is proud to be one of the GTA’s Top Employers for 2023, our fifth year in a row! We think that says a lot about the culture and work environment we’ve built over the last 150+ years. We are all about growth and learning: every position in our organization offers both challenges and opportunities, and we encourage all our staff to establish themselves within and beyond their individual roles. Whether through our employee recognition program, or in our close-knit office environment, we make sure that support and opportunity are always within reach.

Qualifications
• 2+ years of experience developing and maintaining websites.
• Bachelor’s degree/diploma in Computers Science, Web Development, or a related field (or equivalent work experience.
• Proficiency in web development languages such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and familiarity with content management systems (WordPress preferred).
• Excellent communication skills to interact with non-technical stakeholders.
• Experience with UI/UX design is advantageous.
• Knowledge of web accessibility standards and SEO best practices.
• Ability to handle multiple priorities and meet tight deadlines.
• Strong verbal and written communication skills with ability to compose correspondence.

Apply

Our online application will give you the option to apply to this role as a complete person, not just a resumé. The application will assess your qualifications, personality traits and workplace preferences, and should take 10 to 15 minutes to complete. After submitting, you'll receive an email inviting you to log in and view your assessment results.

We strive to build a team that reflects the diversity of the community we work in and encourage applications from traditionally underrepresented groups such as women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, people identifying as LGBTQ2SI, veterans, and people with disabilities. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us using the “Help” button

jobs.title: wanted: Lead Web Developer - yeah YOU
jobs.description:
Hi there,

I hope you are doing well. We are doing fine here.

..and here's why:

- We are an established company, conceived in 2007 and still truckin in 2015

- We've built a huge client base, built around offering collaborative and conferencing solutions for small to medium business

- We've started an internal "start up" dedicated to offering these customers "Digital Media" solutions, such as: website design and development, SEO, content and social media market

- This start up is experience quite a bit of success in it's inaugural year

So? What now?

We want to bring on someone who's lived and breathed web development for at least a few years now.

So, what do we mean by "web development"? Here's how we define it:

- straight up HTML5
- CSS (ideally along with a pre-processor like SASS or LESS)
- Javascript (yeah! that guy)
- an eye for design and aesthetics
- experience with CMSs, like Wordpress, Drupal/Joomla (yeah, I know...)

Here's the kicker: we want someone sharp, and a go... getter, a "figure-outter".

Most of the time we are doing clean rebuilds, but sometimes we need to fix a complete turd of a site before we move onto bigger and better offerings.

We don't need years and years of experience on these stacks right? Because the thing about being SMART is being able to FIGURE STUFF OUT.

We aren't a straight forward development company, nor are we a traditional company in many regards. We are loud, we are smart, we are proactive, we are innovative, and we are fun.

This isn't a stock job description, because we aren't a stock company, and are not looking for stock people.

Rock stars need not apply; only legit down to earth people.

Oh yeah, beers at 4 every friday.

Make contact with a resume to learn more about this FULL TIME position in DOWNTOWN TORONTO.

We screen well also, so bulk resume blasters.. we see you coming a mile away.

Also no recruiters. Yup

The Web Developer (.NET) will be an expert in using dynamic programming tools and languages that build web applications that are efficient, secure and function to set standards for Canadian Tire’s Retail Learning Platform. Your role will be to develop applications and test them on various browsers, enhancing and modifying them as necessary to ensure the best experience for the user.

In partnership with the Manager, the Web Developer is responsible for the timely delivery of projects by defining and coordinating work priorities with the Senior Developers.
• Act as an expert resource providing insight and recommendations based on business requirements of the project.
• Investigate, review and recommend new emerging technologies and tools and communicate on technical issues with all stakeholders in a clear manner.
• Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
• Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communications skills
• Able to clearly... communicate technical information to a non-technical audience.
• Passionate about learning and sharing knowledge.
• Proven ability to work with shifting priorities and with minimal supervision.

What you bring
• Degree/diploma in computer science, web development or equivalent experience
• 3+ years working experience in web application development.
• Excellent knowledge of web development frameworks (ASP.NET, MVC, Entity framework etc.)
• Highly proficient with the .NET Framework 4.0 and higher, .NET Core using C#.
• Proficiency in web development technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, JSON, Bootstrap, AJAX, and XML

• Test and debug code to ensure that applications are error-free and meet requirements. follow agile software development process.

Hybrid

At Canadian Tire we value flexibility. We have adopted a hybrid work model whereby employees use a combination of working in office and virtually in service of outcomes. Each leader is empowered to decide what work is best achieved in person based on the unique needs of their team.

#LI-GT1

About Us

Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With more than 90 Owned Brands, 1,700 retail locations, financial services, exemplary e-commerce capabilities, and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies. We dream big and work as one to innovate with purpose for our customers at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on top talent to drive the company forward. We offer competitive salaries and wages to CTC employees, as well as store discounts, supported learning through our Triangle Learning Academy, Canadian Tire Profit Sharing, and retirement and savings programs for eligible employees. As part of our enhanced flex benefits program, we offer mental health benefits in the amount of $5,000 per year for benefits-eligible employees and their families, including total well-being, and mental health tools and resources for all employees. Join us in helping to make life in Canada better through living and working our Core Values: we are innovators and entrepreneurs at our core, outcomes drive us, inclusion is a must, we are stronger together and we take personal responsibility. It is an especially exciting time to join CTC and its family of companies where career opportunities are wide-ranging! Join us, where there's a place for you here.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging

We are committed to fostering an environment where belonging thrives, and diversity, inclusion and equity are infused into everything we do. We believe in building an organizational culture where people are consistently treated with dignity while respecting individual religion, nationality, gender, race, age, perceived ability, spoken language, sexual orientation, and identification. We are united in our purpose of being here to help make life in Canada better.

Accommodations

We stand firm in our Core Value that inclusion is a must. We welcome and encourage candidates from equity-seeking groups such as people who identify as racialized, Indigenous, 2SLGBTQIA+, women, people with disabilities, and beyond. Should you require any accommodation in applying for this role, or throughout the interview process, please make them known when contacted and we will work with you to help meet your needs

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer
jobs.description:
Are you looking for a rewarding and exciting opportunity to make a difference with a great organization? Look no further!

As we move through a period of exciting and challenging organizational change, Professional Engineers Ontario (PEO) has an immediate opening for an Accounting Administrator to join the Finance team.

Under the authority of the Professional Engineers Act, PEO licenses and governs over 91,500 licence and certificate holders and regulates the practice of professional engineering in Ontario. PEO's mission is to regulate and advance the practice of engineering to protect the public interest. With a talented, multi-disciplinary staff of over 100, PEO's vision is to be a trusted leader in professional self-regulation.

Position Summary

As we move through a period of exciting organizational change, Professional Engineers Ontario (PEO) has an immediate opening for a Senior Web Developer. This position will design, deliver, and maintain functional web infrastructures by... closely collaborating with different teams from various vendors and service providers to ensure the efficiency, integrity and security of PEO’s online applications and services.

Responsibilities

General Responsibilities
• Implement and enforce user access policies and procedures of different online services and web applications for all sorts of users in both Production and Development system by communicating plans and strategies across the team to ensure PEO’s business needs and operations are met.
• Analyze, create and execute the technical Implementation Plan for various web applications and components, including email delivering facility, in Production environment (push changes, new applications and components into Production system) by following best practices of Quality Assurance (QA) procedures to ensure PEO’s web applications/services meet the targeted service level.
• Design, develop and implement new or added features for web applications by closely working across teams within PEO, and outside service providers as well, to provide solutions to new business needs and improve current web applications/components.
• Provide technical supports (level 2 and 3) by investigating problems and needs of wide range of users (including general public, members, councillors, chapter volunteers and PEO staff) of PEO’s online services (such as online Credit Card payment, members’ portal, PEO main website, member directory, all chapter websites and Newsletter delivering system, etc.) and identifying the sources of problems and requirements in order to determine and provide best possible solutions in a timely manner.

Our success is determined by the strength and diversity of our staff and by supporting our core values: integrity, inclusiveness, collaboration and excellence.

What can I expect to do in this role?

Web Developer

The Information Services Branch of the Legislative Assembly of Ontario seeks a Web Developer to join our development team in Toronto. Our Web Developers analyze, design, develop and support our websites including our main site (ola.org). Are you looking for a rewarding career where you can share your expertise? Join our team and... help us promote innovation while respecting the great traditions of Ontario's parliament. The Information Services Branch is located at Queen's Park in Toronto, ON.

Keeping Ontario's Legislative Assembly running smoothly takes many talented people, doing many different jobs—from camera operators and committee clerks, to purchasing officers and researchers. The Office of the Assembly is dedicated to serving Ontario's Parliament.

jobs.title: Full stack Web developer
jobs.description:
Company Description

Saatchi & Saatchi is an advertising agency with the belief that creativity, data, media and technology should all work together, and we use that to influence human behavior and drive success for clients. S&S is one of the world's largest agency networks with 114 offices and more than 6000 employees globally. Here in our Toronto office we work with some of the countries most valued brands including Toyota, Lexus, Quesada and Mondelez just to name a few. We’re an award winning agency in both creativity and effectiveness, so it’s really important for us here to convert that innovation and the great ideas into real tangible business results for the organization.

Job Description

Our Toronto-based communications company is seeking an Intermediate Full Stack Web Developer to join our team. We're looking for a problem solver who can navigate complex systems, design robust architectures, and create seamless user experiences.

Responsibilities:
• Design, develop, test... deploy, maintain and improve software across the stack.
• Manage individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
• Work on solutions for challenging problems, including API systems, internal tools, and other technical challenges.
• Develop standards-compliant and usable websites and contribute to site documentation.
• Participate in project processes, contribute to project completion, and be accountable to deadlines.
• Exercise best practices, current trends, and come up with creative solutions to development problems or obstacles.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a similar technical field of study, or equivalent practical experience.
• 3-6 years of experience in full stack web development.
• Strong foundation in computer science principles, including data structures, algorithms, software design and system design.
• Experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and responsive design.
• Experience in web application development using technologies such as Java, Angular, React, and AEM.
• Experience with SQL Server, MySQL, or other relational databases.
• Understanding of web application security best practices.
• Knowledge of web accessibility best practices and standards, such as WCAG 2.0 & 2.1.
• Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly.
• Ability to work in a team environment, not only implementing but also helping to define and design system architectures.
• Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and a strong sense of ownership.

Preferred Qualifications:
• Experience with cloud services like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure.
• Experience with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
• Familiarity with modern web development trends such as GraphQL, TypeScript, serverless architectures, and microservices.
• Experience with mobile development frameworks like React Native or Flutter.
• AEM certification or significant experience with AEM.
• Familiarity with various industry-standard graphic and design tools such as Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, Zeplin, Figma, Principle, and diagramming/wireframing tools.
• Experience with other backend languages like Python, Ruby, or Go.
• Knowledge of NoSQL databases like MongoDB, CouchDB, or DynamoDB.
• Familiarity with testing frameworks such as JUnit, TestNG, or Jest.

Additional Information

Saatchi & Saatchi Toronto is an equal opportunity employer with a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Drawing on valuable perspectives and insights from our unique workforce allows us to continue sharing our best work with the world. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals and will provide appropriate accommodation for candidates with disabilities or accessibility needs throughout the recruitment process, upon request. Please contact our recruiter for any questions, accommodations or specific requests

jobs.description:
Our employees are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. When you join our team, you’re bringing this purpose to life alongside a passionate community of experts.

Feel empowered to learn and grow while being valued for who you are– here, diversity is a strength. You have our commitment to support you in reaching your goals with tools, opportunities, and flexibility. It’s our employee promise.

Our hybrid work model provides the balance between working from home and enjoying meaningful in-person interactions.

Read on to see how you can shape the future, win as a team, and grow with us.

About the role

We’re looking for a Software Development I to join our growing team!

As a Web Developer Co-op/Intern, you will participate in a 16-month placement to gain valuable, first-hand, corporate and professional experience at the largest provider property and casualty insurance in Canada, and a leading... provider of specialty insurance in North America

What you’ll do here:
• Innovate and develop on our internal dashboard to meet needs from users and fellow co-workers
• Code in a modern technology stack:

o Next JS, React

o REST API, Python, Fast API

o SQL, MongoDB
• Gain proficiency with IntelliJ / VS Code and other development tools
• Contribute in Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) application development using GitHub, Docker and OpenShift environments
• Create applications using industry standard development methodologies, such as Agile/Scrum/Kanban
• Provide proactive and reactive support for production systems to guarantee their functionality
• Resolve Incidents, Defects and Problem tickets by finding creative solutions, solving complex problems, coding, testing, and debugging a wide variety of systems
• Be creative and come up with ideas to improve our services and user experiences

What you bring to the table:
• Currently pursuing a university degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field
• Available to work with us for 16 months from May 2024 to August 2024
• Must be returning to full time studies in 2025 following the internship
• Preference for student graduating in 2025 and enrolled in a formal co-op/internship program
• Familiarity with:
• Building server-side apps using Java 8+, JDBC, Hibernate
• Creating web services or APIs using REST (and or SOAP), Spring Boot, Spring framework
• Relational databases like Oracle (and PL/SQL) and No-SQL databases such as MongoDB or ElasticSearch
• Students with a passion for learning about application development practices and methodologies
• A “can do” attitude, passion for problem solving, and the ability to take initiative
• Basic coding experience is an asset

Your career starts here. Apply today!

We can’t wait to learn more about you. When you complete your application, remember to include your resume and University/College transcript. We hire co-ops every semester (Winter, Summer and Fall)! We’re accepting applications now through September 22, 2023 at 11:59pm EST. All submissions will be reviewed during this time, as well as after the posting closes.

What we offer

Working here means you'll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a temporary member of our team:
• Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

• A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique.

We are an equal opportunity employer

jobs.title: Joist - Junior Web Engineer (Remote, Canada)
jobs.description:
Junior Web Engineer, Joist– REMOTE (Canada)

EverCommerce [Nasdaq: EVCM] is a leading service commerce platform, providing vertically tailored, integrated SaaS solutions that help more than 600,000 global service-based businesses accelerate growth, streamline operations, and increase retention. Our modern digital and mobile applications create predictable, informed, and convenient experiences between customers and their service professionals. Specializing in Home & Field Services, Health Services, and Fitness & Wellness industries, EverCommerce solutions include end-to-end business management software, embedded payment acceptance, marketing technology, and customer engagement applications.

We are building an extraordinary company and looking for talented, energetic, and motivated people to join our team. You can learn more about our Company, Culture and Values here: https://www.evercommerce.com/about-us/careers/

We are looking for a Junior Web Engineer to focus on our Joist product... Joist, an EverCommerce solution group and member of the EverPro suite of products, is an end to end vertical software platform for small & medium-sized trades contractors. We have a simple mission: Make Contractors Heroes. Joist provides web and mobile applications for small business contractors to estimate, invoice, record, and process payments, and manage projects from anywhere. From humble beginnings, we're now helping over 1 million contractors across North America, the UK, and Australia, making us one of the largest trades platforms in the world and we have major growth planned!

Responsibilities:

You will contribute to solutions from inception to deployment, and everything in between. The solutions you and your team build must not only work for Joist today, but also support rapid iteration and innovation as we grow. Your work is going to be nothing less than redefining the home renovation industry. The key aspects of this role include:

CS Fundamentals: You have an understanding of algorithms, data structures, design patterns and data storage technologies. You are able to select the right tool for the right job.

Code Quality: You write effective, modern, and highly readable code. You are receptive to feedback and suggestions on how to make your code better, and you are excited to contribute to a live, highly used, production application.

Teamwork Many of the problems we encounter require insight from many parts of the business. Your ability to coordinate and communicate is essential to our success.

Passion: Hard problems are not solved overnight. It takes a special kind of attitude and hunger to disrupt an entrenched industry. Your passion is what you share with every teammate at Joist. Passion for technology, passion for change, passion for learning, and passion for building an industry revolutionizing product.

Skills and Experience needed for success in this role:
• Hands on experience with vanilla Javascript ES6+ and one or more JS frameworks (Preferably React or similar)
• Hands on experience with JS data structures such as arrays, objects and use best practices while working with them
• Hands on experience working with CSS pre-processor such as SASS/SCSS
• Hands on experience in developing responsive web apps
• Hands on experience with a version control system such as GIT
• Able to take constructive feedback positively and looking for ways to improve
• Comfortable in working with minimal supervision and asking the right questions to get themselves unblocked
• Bonus Skills and Experience for this role:
• Familiarity with a state management library for React such as Redux Toolkit or similar
• Familiarity with a unit testing framework such as Jest & Enzyme or similar
• Familiarity with any form library, preferably Formik
• Familiarity with accessibility

Where:

The EverCommerce team is distributed globally, with teams in the U.S., Canada, the U.K., Jordan, New Zealand, and Australia. With a widely distributed team, we are used to working remotely across different time zones. This role can be based anywhere in Canada – if you’re close to one of our offices, we can set you up in-office or you can work 100% remotely. Please note that you must be eligible to work without sponsorship to qualify for this position, and this role may require travel to our Corporate Headquarters in Denver, Colorado, or to other office locations around North America.

Benefits & Perks:
• Flexibility to work where/how you want within your country of employment – in-office, remote, or hybrid
• Robust wellness benefits, including an annual wellness stipend
• 3 weeks of vacation to start, a paid volunteer day of your choosing, plus 2 floating holidays to celebrate anything of significance to you
• Employee Stock Purchase Program
• Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) with 4% company match
• Continued investment in your professional development through Udemy

EverCommerce is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We look forward to reviewing your credentials and getting to know more about your experience
